p: Plants of A. philoxeroides and H. scandens were collected from the campus of Anhui Agriculture University in China (N31°52′, E117°16′). Fresh H. scandens roots were dried to constant weight under shade, and ground to fine powder passing through 40 mesh sieve, then put in a desiccator. The A. philoxeroides plants were cut into several cuttings, each with one node. The regents 95% ethanol, petroleum ether, ethyl acetate, and n-butanol were analytical pure, purchased from Jinan Century Tongda Chemical Co., Ltd.
